result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew B Hamilton

records.addlTxt:
10:58 AM Defendant Andrew B Hamilton in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today. 8 contacts.
of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records Without Extrinsic Evidence, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements, by the State.
and Summary of Expert Testimony of Law Enforcement Officer and/or Analyst, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:38 PM Defendant Andrew B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Andrew B Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
